properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 2:19 a.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-08T09:14:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T06:19:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1260532510.2020
Area: Miquelon - Desmaraisville area, La Sarre area, Amos area, Malartic area

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Oppressive heat wave A warm and humid air mass over Southern Quebec will continue over the next few days. Beginning today, temperatures will exceed the 30-degree mark during the day and will not fall below 20 degrees at night. The combined temperature and humidity values will give humidex values of 40. These conditions could last into Saturday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-08T18:47:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T02:48:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0933577910.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:23 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms extends from near Melita down to the international border and is traveling east at 60 km/h. This line has a history of producing wind gusts in excess of 100 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-08T07:29:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T05:24:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0899633858.2020
Area: Mun. of Two Borders incl. Melita Coulter and Tilston, Mun. of Brenda-Waskada incl. Medora and Goodlands, Mun. of Deloraine-Winchester
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Severe thunderstorms could continue to develop until late this evening and possibly into the overnight hours. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-08T10:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T03:58:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3101693238.2020
